Title: Informants enabled attacks on schools, says Niger gov
Summary: Governor Muhammad Umaru Bago of Niger State suggested that informants play a significant role in enabling terrorist attacks . He called for stricter measures against them as part of efforts to tackle insecurity in the state .

Title: Lawmaker offers N54m scholarship to 2,199 Katsina students
Summary: Lawmaker offers N54m scholarship to 2,199 Katsina students . Hon. Abdullahi Ahmed has doled out more than N54 million in scholarship .

Title: DHQ denies plans to conscript young Nigerians
Summary: DHQ denies plans to forcefully recruit Nigerians from the age of 18 years into the armed forces against their will . Defence Headquarters denied plans to forcibly recruit young Nigerians .

Title: Institute seeks regulatory commission to fix Nigeria’s ailing courier, logistics sector
Summary: Institute seeks regulatory commission to fix Nigeria’s ailing courier, logistics sector . CLMI chairman has called for the establishment of an independent commission .

Title: TikToker arrested after staging kidnapping for social media attention in Edo
Summary: Edo Police Command has arrested and charged Osarobo Omoyemen for falsely announcing her own kidnapping in a TikTok video . Edo police command has arrested her and charged her with false kidnapping .

Title: Arsenal vs Tottenham: EPL leaders seek to go six points clear with win
Summary: Arsenal head into Sunday’s North London Derby against Tottenham Hotspur . EPL leaders seek to go six points clear with a win over Spurs . Arsenal face Spurs in a dramatic round of Premier League results on Saturday .

Title: NDLEA arrests nine kingpins in massive crackdown on drug
Summary: In Kogi state, NDLEA operatives intercepted a trailer conveying 4,700 kilograms of skunk, a strain of cannabis, at Kabba . The trailer was conveying the cannabis, a cannabis strain, to Kabba, Kogi . It was intercepted on Monday, 17th November .

Title: 600m people still lack access to electricity – reports
Summary: 600 million people across Africa still live without access to electricity . Europe leads €15.5bn clean energy drive for Africa . The situation is becoming more urgent as Africa’s population is projected to double .

Title: Insecurity: FG must act, not just condemn – Labour Party
Summary: The party said this in response to the abduction of over 300 schoolchildren from St. Mary’s Catholic Primary and Secondary School in Niger State .

Title: NAPTIP seeks collective efforts to end human trafficking in Jigawa
Summary: The National Agency for the Prohibition of Trafficking in Persons (NAPTIP) called for collective efforts from stakeholders, to end cases of human trafficking in Jigawa .
